intro: Psychotria spadicea, commonly known as the red-eyed wonder, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking red bracts that surround small white flowers, making it visually distinctive. Psychotria spadicea typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests.
